results.title: Snow falling on cedars [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kennedy/Marshall Company, Harry J Ufland, Ron Bass-Kennedy, Universal Pictures, Kathleen Kennedy, Garry Marshall, Ron Bass and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Nine years after the bombing of Pearl Harbour, a small town in the Pacific Northwest still struggles with the troubling legacy of U.S. policies against Asian-Americans. In December 1950, just off the shores of San Piedro Island in Washington, a Japanese-American man Kazuo Miyamoto (Rick Yune) stands accused of murder after his close friend Carl Heine (Eric Thal) is found drowned in icy waters. As the trial gets under way, with Alvin Hooks (James Rebhorn) prosecuting Kazuo and Nels Gudmundsson (Max Von Sydow) defending him, reporter Ishmael Chambers (Ethan Hawke) covers the proceedings for the local newspaper. The trial strikes a deep emotional chord with Ishmael when he finds his ex-lover is linked to the case. As he investigates the killing he uncovers some startling clues that lead him to a shocking discovery. Based on the novel of the same name by David Guterson.

results.title: Snow cat: based on the book by Dayal Kaur Khalsa
results.creator_credit: Snow Cat Productions, ONF | NFB, Sheldon Cohen, Kenneth Hirsch and Marcy Page
results.brief_description: On a cold snowy afternoon, a grandmother captivates her granddaughter’s attention with the tale of a lonely girl and a magic cat. A story of enduring love by artist and filmmaker Sheldon Cohen, recipient of many prestigious prizes, including the British Academy Award. In ‘Snow cat’ he works collaboratively with animator Jeami, who designed an original finger-paint technique for the film.

results.title: Snow camp
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and National Fitness Council of Tasmania
results.brief_description: Aimed at the experienced bushwalker, this film discusses survival in the snow country. Includes instructions on the building of igloos and other shelters. Suitable for upper secondary and teertiary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Hugh O'Connor and Barrie Angus McLean
results.brief_description: Snow has a kind of life: it changes form or “ripens,” its very whiteness serves a purpose. In this film you see frost crystals forming in the upper atmosphere, delicate filigree flakes that, settling on the ground, by sheer weight of numbers clog our roads and driveways. The film shows why powder snow is a favorite of skiers, and why corn snow may, in high places, warn of developing avalanches.

results.title: Snow
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of a snow blanketed countryside, trees laden with snow, snow melting on bushes, a mountain stream half-covered with snow and ice and footsteps in the snow. No narration - music only. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Railways and Geoffrey Jones
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film, with no commentary and with visuals set against a rhythmic music background. Shows a train ploughing through snow country and the work of track gangs to maintain services during a severe winter. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Snofari
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Grant Foster
results.brief_description: A visitor to New Zealand and a friend spend a week in Queenstown in winter. They enjoy the winter sports of skiing and skating. They also hike over the surrounding countryside, visit the lakes and take a trip on the steamer, “Earnslaw”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Grant Foster

results.title: Sniffles and sneezes
results.brief_description: Explains that colds are the result of viruses, portrays common ways of spreading cold germs, and illustrates how the body defends itself against germs. Shows how to prevent colds and what to do if a cold has started.

results.title: Snatch [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Matthew Vaughn and Guy Ritchie
results.brief_description: Guy Ritchie’s second feature follows on seamlessly from his first: the music video/caper movie, “Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels”. It’s cast - peppered with Hollywood stars Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina and Brad Pitt - portray a crowd of London small-timers torturing, mutilating and wise-cracking their way across Ritchie’s home territory: ludicrous plots, racial stereotypes and groovy pop music, all in the name of derisively good fun. If “Lock, Stock” was an escapade into guilt-free sick violence, then “Snatch” is exactly the same.
